title: 113_s32
content: The "Child Custody Protection Act of 2013" is cited as the short title. It amends Title 18 of the United States Code by adding a new chapter on the transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act of 2013" adds a new chapter on transportation of minors in circumvention of laws regarding abortion and incest. Sec. 2431 defines laws requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision. The term 'parent' in the "Child Custody Protection Act of 2013" includes a parent, guardian, legal custodian, or an individual designated by law requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision. The "Child Custody Protection Act of 2013" defines a minor as an individual not older than the maximum age requiring parental notification or consent for abortion. It also states that whoever knowingly transports a minor across state lines to obtain an abortion, thereby infringing on parental rights, may face fines or imprisonment. The "Child Custody Protection Act of 2013" prohibits transporting a minor across state lines for abortion without parental consent, with penalties of fines or imprisonment. Exceptions include abortions necessary to save the minor's life due to physical endangerment. Exceptions include abortions necessary to save the minor's life due to physical endangerment. Minors and parents cannot be prosecuted for violating this section, and there is an affirmative defense if the defendant reasonably believed the minor had parental consent or notification before the abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act of 2013" prohibits transporting a minor across state lines for abortion without parental consent. Violators may face fines or imprisonment. Exceptions include abortions necessary to save the minor's life. Parents can seek civil action for harm caused by violations. In cases of incest, transporting a minor for abortion across state lines is punishable by fines or imprisonment. The table of chapters for part I of title 18, United States Code, is amended by inserting a new item after chapter 117. Transportation of minors in circumvention of laws relating to abortion.
